summary:
He had noticed how everyone changed.

And it had all begun with his lost notebook.

One day he was still fine, laughing with his friends and raising his hand during every lesson, the next he was alone and scared of speaking up.
The teachers glared at him, his friends avoided him, and the only ones seemingly unaffected by whatever happened were Present Mic, Shinsou, Todoroki and Asui.

Then he was suddenly sitting in an interrogation room, with his previously lost notebook laying in front of him.

 

What the hell was going on?

text:
"What do you use these notebooks for?" 
 
The officer's eyes were cold and hard as stone as they pierced his eyes like an arrow. 
 
Maybe even right through them and into his very heart, leaving a gaping hole of nothing but blackness.
 
Emptiness.
 
... and numbness. 
 
With wide eyes and growing horror, his gaze fell onto the figures behind the glass pane, the faint outline of his reflection blocking the clear view of the people behind it. 
 
But they were all far too familiar to him. 
 
He could have recognized them anywhere, even if it was pitch black in the room. 
 
A̶i̶z̶a̶w̶a̶-s̶e̶n̶s̶e̶i̶ Eraserhead was there and a few other pro heroes and teachers at U.A, including Nedzu. 
 
And Sir Nighteye. 
 
... and... All Might...
 

...o̶f̶ c̶o̶u̶r̶s̶e̶ h̶e̶'d̶ b̶e̶ h̶e̶r̶e̶ w̶h̶a̶t̶ h̶a̶d̶ h̶e̶ e̶x̶p̶e̶c̶t̶e̶—

 
'Oh', he thought bitterly.
 
'U.A. was supposed to be different... I was a fool to think anything would change.'
 
 
 
 
 
The last two weeks have been strange, to say the least.
 
As he should have known, and as many problems in his life, everything started with his notebook. 
 
Specifically him forgetting his newest one in the classroom. 
 
'So stupid...', he thought. '...that all it had taken was h̶i̶s̶ n̶o̶t̶e̶b̶o̶o̶k̶ that thing, that stupid little thing.' 
It shouldn't have been a big deal, really, because even if someone found it, his name was written on it and the person could give it back. 
Besides, those notebooks weren't a big deal at all, he wasn't hiding anything in them. Everyone knew his obsession with heroes and that he absolutely adored analyzing them, though the answer as to why he loved that hobby so much he always left unanswered. 
 
Not that he didn't trust his friends, because he did! It took a lot of time and effort, but he could safely say that he trusted them with his life now, and yet the whole topic surrounding his quirkless past was still something he kept under wraps. 
 
And those notebooks were a big part of it. 
 
They weren't just a hobby, they were also a coping mechanism to calm his mind, focus and not feel completely useless to society. 
It was the only thing that made him feel smart in middle school when the teachers continously faked his grades, and the children laughed about it. 
 

At least they couldn't fake the notebooks and amount of effort he put in them. 

 
He was able to get Shinsou to open up to him thanks to them, after Izuku proposed different ways he could use his quirk and convinced him repeatedly that the quirk he had was so useful for underground work. 
 
Todoroki had come to him, too. After the Hosu incident, both of them had come a lot closer and hung out in his room. That day, the green haired boy had pulled out his notebook and asked him questions about both sides of his quirk, proposing different ways to improve his weak points and fighting style. ((...and created a draft with the title Eat shit Endeavor, a compilation of evidences, stats and graphs that not only proved he was not worthy of being the number two hero but could also get him stripped of his title ;D yk, for later purposes )) 
 
So yeah, technically, he had nothing to worry about.
 
It was fine.
 
... but then the next day, the book was gone.
 
He had come to class in the morning, sitting down on his usual spot behind Kacchan and chattered away with Uraraka, who had greeted him after coming in moments later.
 
Then he remembered the notebook.
 
Izuku had subtly glanced around his table, then asked Uraraka if she had seen it, but the girl had shaken her head.
He vaguely heard Bakugou muttering 'stupid nerd, always loosing his shit', but didn't pay it any mind, instead opting to ask his other friends, who also denied having seen it.
 
Weird.
 
But there wasn't much to worry about, Izuku had thought. After all, maybe a teacher had grabbed it and would give it back later.
 

[Come to think of it, maybe he could voice some of the ideas written there out loud during their next training session, especially because there were a few new techniques he wanted to try out with Kirishima, Urakaka and Shinsou... ] 

 
 
... Then homeroom started.
 
It was all good, until Aizawa's eyes fell on Midoriya, and the temperature in the room seemed to have dropped several degrees. No one except Izuku himself had noticed, because where everyone had gotten the ususal tired looks, he was greeted with the stone-cold, piercing glare Izuku remembered being directed at the League of Villains during various instances. 
 

... Did he... Do something wrong...? 

 
The underground hero's eyes had lingered on him a while more, looking him up and down as if searching for something, before he abruptly turned away from the green haired boy and started the lesson with a quick roll call before getting to the actual topic. 
 
Again, the teacher had hesitated when calling his name, and when he did say it, it sounded distant and cold, wrong. 
 
Something was wrong, he concluded, but shrugged it off as the man simply having a bad day. It was no surprise he would show it on Midoriya of all people, after all, it was clear that he was his least favorite student, if the name 'Problem Child' was anything to go by.
 
But even so, Izuku didn't pay the weird behavior any more attention and focused on going on with the day.
 
 
... only to discover that it wasn't only Eraserhead who was behaving weirdly.
 
In fact, except for Present Mic, everyone's expression seemed to have grown cold and calculating upon seeing him.
Even All Might, All Might, the man he got his quirk from, his mentor, seemed a bit more different than usual. He was distant, movements stiff and words monotone as he explained the exercise they'd be doing today.
 
Present Mic was the only "normal" one, which put Izuku's mind a little bit at ease.
He was just as loud as he normally was, his expression was just as bright as every other day and he called Midoriya 'Little Listener' just like all the other times.
 
But if he was still on good terms with Midoriya, what was wrong with everyone else?
 
 
 
 
The next day, he had needed to use the bathroom for a moment during Midnight's class. 
 
The heroine — clearly hesitant and distrustfully eyeing him up and down — excused him. 
 
On the way to the bathroom, he wracked his head about what could have happened for everything to change so suddenly.
 

Had they found out about him being quirkless before U.A.?

 

Had he subconsciously done something to make everyone angry?

 

Or maybe they finally realised what a waste of time he actually was?

 
Because the looks he was getting, they were the same ones he got from his old teachers in elementary and middle school. It made him extremely uncomfortable, because he had hoped U.A. would be different.
 
In U.A., everyone had cared about him, had encouraged him and supported him from the start.... o̶r̶ s̶o̶ h̶e̶ t̶h̶o̶u̶g̶h̶t̶... 
 
From the very first day at the hero school, to the Sport's Festival, to the Hosu Incident, Bakugou's kidnapping, the Provisional License Exam and Eri's rescue, nobody had ever, EVER, behaved that way.
 
And his notebook was still nowhere to be found, too.
 
He had to have been gone for no more than fifteen minutes, but when he came back to class, his breath caught in his throat at the sight.
 
Standing in the classroom was Eraserhead, seemingly just having finished saying something [maybe to the heroine who was holding a stack of paper in her hands that wasn't there before], and the whole class whipped around to stare at him with wide, suspecting eyes the moment he opened the door. 
 
What the hell was going on?
 
Kacchan seemed angry and disbelieving, Uraraka and Iida were looking lost, and the rest of the class was eyeing him with those same cold and hard eyes as all the teachers. Guarded, his mind inquired. Suspecting. 
 
But why? 
 
The only ones not affected, though looking angered were Asui, Todoroki and Shinsou. ( a weird look on their faces, since they weren't the type to get angry easily.) 
 
As fast as he could, he dashed towards his seat and sat down, looking at the table to save himself from those looks.
 
Eraserhead left and Midnight continued her lesson, but every once in a while, someone of his classmates would glance at him before drastically turning away when Midoriya looked at them, as if afraid of him glancing back at them. 
 
What was happening?!
 
 
 
 
Things only seemed to have gotten worse after that. A week after it all started, the teachers were going extra hard on him, the second week, almost all of his classmates had started avoiding him, and by the time the third week came around, even Uraraka and Iida had distanced themselves from him.
 
It devastated him to no end.
 
Was he really that disgusting to be around?
 
He thought he had finally made friends after attending U.A., but somehow, he was still a useless, disgusting, weird Deku to be around.
 
Kirishima had stopped calling him Midori-bro.
 
Kaminari had stopped slinging a hand over his shoulder in a friendly manner when the other wasn't expecting it.
 
Mina stopped talking to him all together.
 
Yaoyorouzu was always observing him with watchful and analytic eyes, as if searching for a flaw in his... whatever it was they started avoiding him because of. 
 
Uraraka wasn't smiling around him anymore.
 
And Iida, though he tried not to show it, would shift away from him when he got too close.
 
And there were other things too. 
 
He hadn't even heard his real name from them for all this time now. 
 
It was always Deku. 
 
It sounded sour, impersonal, just Deku, as if they were strangers, nothing more. 
 
When Izuku had started writing in his new analysis notebook, the other one still nowhere to be found, the whole class seemed to shift uncomfortably in their seats. There were eyes on him, frigid and unforgiving, and slowly, the boy had put down the pen, not missing how everyone seemed to relax at that. 
 

Were they scared of his notebooks? 

 
But that was ridiculous... They knew what was in them, what he wrote about, why did they look like that? 
 
The next thing everyone had started to get creeped out about was the muttering.
 
It was during class, where he started muttering again, only to have gotten shut up by Kaminari, who glared his way.
 
His mouth and mind always ran faster than his hands, that's why he needed to sort and voice his thoughts out loud, to actually remember everything he needed for his analysis and schoolwork. 
 
And now, in the span of a few weeks, they all made him think it was freakish and weird, that he should be ashamed of it. 
 
It wouldn't have bothered him were it his classmates from middle school, but those were his friends, or well, former friends... and it hurt, to see them look repelled at even his voice. 
 

Why did it not bother them before, then? 

 
With every passing day, it seemed that the whole school had turned against him, as if he was some kind of villain that they needed to get rid of.
 
But he didn't understand.
 
He risked his life, broke his bones for every single one of the people he considered friends, only to have them turn their backs on him?
 
All Might, out of all people, treated him like an enemy, for God's sake!
 
He wouldn't answer his calls, refused to meet up with the other, and started failing him in hero class. 
 
The same went for the rest of the staff.
 
He studied and studied, but somehow failed every test or barely passed and everytime they worked in pairs during the hero exercises, it was always Midoriya, useless Deku, who would get the role of the villain and nobody would be willing to pair up with him.
 
Except for Todoroki, Tsuyu and Shinsou.
 
The three of them were the only ones who were still willing to be friends with him. Whatever was going on, they knew about it, but still decided to be with him.
He could have asked them what was going on, but right now, them willingly choosing to stay with him was more than he could have asked for, and he was wanted to treasure that.
 
And if they didn't tell him themselves, it could mean they were threatened to keep quiet about it. 
 
Kacchan was also one of the only people who didn't change. Still as loud and brash as ever, but after their fight at Ground Beta, they were starting to sort things out. Right now though, it seemed that he was ready to explode at everything and everyone, especially at the teachers.
Maybe it also had something to do with why everyone was being so weird.
Then again, if everyone was acting so hostile towards him, why wasn't Bakugou?
Sure, they had talked a bit about their feelings at Ground Beta, but their issues weren't resolved yet. So why...
 
The green haired boy sighed.
 
The only person within U.A.'s staff who was still incredibly kind to him was Present Mic. His eyes were warm and kind, he answered every question Izuku asked carefully and even explained small detail about his quirk that most likely counted as classified. And yet he trusted Izuku enough to tell him... 
 
Yamada had actually seemed interested when the green haired boy showed him his notebook entry, amazed by the length of the analysis and amount of information he didn't even know was noticeable to the people around. 
 
Today though... Today was different. English was their last lesson, followed by lunch, and Hizashi was looking strangely sad and angry at the same time. No, scratch that, he was definitely seething.
Izuku tried shrugging it off, but his stomach was churning at the thought of the last teacher who had been kind to him, suddenly changing like everyone else. 
 
Was it just a play-pretend? 
 

Did he not care about him after all?

 

Was it really just an act? 

 
Five minutes before the lesson ended, Present Mic spoke up. 
 
"Hey Little Listener, could you please see me after class?"
 
Midoriya's face fell. 'Don't be like that... You should have expected this...'
 
Nodding mutely, the green haired boy felt himself panic, standing up stiffly and walking towards the teacher's desk. A small, secure pat on his shoulder and Shinsou opened his mouth.
 
"We'll be waiting for you to eat lunch together, 'Zuku, okay?"
 
Then they were gone as well and Midoriya was left alone with the blonde haired man.
He expected to get scolded, shouted at or even punched. Maybe told that he would get expelled. 
 
Closing his eyes in expectation, he never thought that two arms would pull him into his chest and hold him there.
 
Huh... 
 
The embrace was warm and secure, and slowly, Izuku felt himself relax into the teacher's hold and return the hug.
 
 
"Izuku listen", Yamada began and the boy's eyes grew wide after hearing his given name from the mouth of a teacher.
 
"I need you to listen carefully, little listener", Yamada began and squeezed his student's shoulders from where he had gripped them tightly. 
 
"I can't even begin to say how sorry I am, for everything and on behalf of everyone's behavior. I'm sorry , I'm really sorry, and I'm so sorry for what's going to happen. I wanted to tell you, I really wanted to, but if I did..." he trailed off and shook his head in both fury and dejection. 
 
The words "the consequences would be grave" were left hanging in the air, but there was no need in saying them out loud, for Izuku understood them clearly. 
 
But... why? 
 
What could be this bad that even Present Mic himself was afraid? 
 
"I'm sorry, little one, so sorry..." 
 
 
The door flew open with a loud bang, making the green haired boy flinch and whirl around, only to see several police officers storming in and advancing towards him whilst screaming to stand still. 
 
He was completely helpless as they handcuffed and pulled him harshly towards the door again, holding back the blonde teacher who wanted to come with them. 
 
What was going on? 
 
Why was this happening? 
 
What did he do wrong?? 
 
Outside of the classroom, he saw the teachers look at him with enraged expressions on their faces. Some of his classmates were also there. Kirishima, Ashido, Shoji, Sero... They were all gazing at him as if he were some shit stain on the ground, a worthless Deku whose existence needed to get evaporated. 
But that's all he ever was to them, right? 
All those smiles and promises were fake, all of them were fake.
 
He started panicking, motions frantic as he looked around in hopes of getting help from one of the students or teachers around him. The police officer's grip was painfully hard, tightening even more when he tried jerking his hands away, and the green haired boy winced. 
 
"IZUKU!!" He heard his name being shouted in the distance and looked up fast enough to catch a glimpse of purple and half white half red advancing towards him. 
 
'Hitoshi, Shoto!!', his mind screamed, body already trying to scramble out of the officer's way and towards his two friends. 
 
But he was too late, and before he could let out a single sound, he was forced head first into the police car.
 
'Just like a criminal', the green haired boy thought in disbelief, as the door closed and they drove off. He wanted to ask so badly what they were doing to him, why he was being handled like a criminal, a villain, but thought better than that. 
 
It's just like in middle school. 
 
You speak up, you make everything worse. 
 
And so they took off, Midoriya feeling smaller and more a Deku than ever before. 
 
 
 
 
As they stopped in front of the police station, he was roughly grabbed by his shoulders, pressing on an old scar that still stung occasionally, and dragged inside. 
 
What he saw there made the last bit of light in his eyes die. 
 
Eraserhead was there, along with All Might, Sir Nighteye and Principal Nedzu. 
Beside them stood at least ten police officers, all looking furious, and it was all directed at him. 
 
"Ai-Aizawa-sensei, what's go-going on?" Midoriya stuttered out helplessly, but his homeroom teacher refused to even acknowledge the question, only glaring at him with a look that he couldn't quite place. 
 
He was brought inside a room, which was completely empty, save for the table in the middle, and a chair on either side. Izuku was forcefully dragged to the seat where he could see the door and the glass pane, his handcuffed hands getting chained to the chair. 
 
Realization struck him with cold terror as a chill went down his spine. 
 
This was an interrogation room. 
 
He was being interrogated... But why?
 
It were approximately ten minutes later that the door swung open and the green haired boy flinched out of fear of what would happen next.
The police officer stopped beside the chair and pushed it away, opting to stand as he slammed a book onto the table. 
 
"What do you use these notebooks for?"
 
Looking down, Izuku realised that this was his analysis notebook he lost some time ago. He blinked a few times before looking at the officer with incomprehending eyes. 
 
He didn't understand...
 

Why were they asking him that?

 
Izuku tried to answer as best as he could through his confusion, but that proved to be the wrong thing to do, because the man slammed his hands onto the table and screamed. 
 
"DO NOT LIE TO ME!" 
 
The officer's eyes were bright with unchecked anger and hard as stone, and all Izuku could do was stare with wide eyes and growing horror behind the glass, looking directly at his homeroom teacher, silently pleading for him to do something. 
But when he refused to look at the boy, only clenching his eyes shut and turning his head away, Midoriya felt tears gather in the corner of his eyes. 
 
And when he looked at everyone else, they only glared at him or looked away as well. 
 
"What do you use these notebooks for?" 
 
The policemen asked again. 
 
"Have you ever given anyone those notebooks with the purpose of hurting someone?" 
 
"Since when were you associated with the league of villains?" 
 
"Do you sell any of that analysis to the League of Villains?" 
 
And 'Oh', he thought bitterly. 'So that's what they mean....' 
 
'U.A. was supposed to be different... I was a fool to think anything would change.'
 
 
 
 
For the next two hours, the police officer continued barking questions at him, shouting and slamming and screaming even louder, not even caring when Izuku broke down completely, sobbing quietly whilst giving the same reply over and over again.
 
But nobody believed him.
 
By the time the third hour came around, he was in an almost catatonic state.
Emotionless, unmoving and completely silent, staring at the table that still contained his notebook.
Tears were still slipping from his eyes, but he wasn't answering anymore. 
 
He completely disassociated.
 
When the police officer left and detective Tsukauchi came in, the damage that had already been done was beyond repair.
 
The man entered and took careful steps to come closer, eyes scanning the boy up and down before settling on his blank face. 
 
This was no villain or traitor. 
 
This was a child that's been broken, accused of something he wasn't, and failed in every way possible.
 
Sitting down on the chair, Tsukauchi sighed before pulling out the sheets with all the questions he needed to ask the boy, every fiber of his body wanting to go against it. 
 
But he knew it needed to be done. 
 
He was neither heartless nor cruel, but still bound to the same rules and laws the police was. 
 
And if the majority wanted to interrogate Midoriya, any objection was useless. 
 
And still... 
 
This boy had risked his life, broke his bones, shattered them and ended up in the hospital more times than he could count, all for the sake of his "friends" and teachers, only to get accused of something so ridiculous? 
 
He was a stellar student, kind, forgiving, selfless and had a pure heart of gold.
 

This was really who they thought was the traitor? 

 
Come on, couldn't they have done at least a little bit better in their choice? 
 

Like seriously, and why the fuck didn't All Might defend him?! He was his successor, his "boy" and yet the "Symbol-of-peace" my ass was standing in front of the room as well, looking almost unbothered by the tumult going on here. 

 
All Might was his friend, a very close one at that, but what the fuck was he thinking?! 
 
This precious boy isn't, wasn't, had never and could never, would never be a traitor. 
 
And besides... After what happened at the USJ...
 
If he would have been the traitor, that villain with the warp gate quirk, Kurogiri would have known which kid to teleport into which section.
 
But they were divided into those different regions randomly, because they didn't know anything about the kids. 
 
Which meant that there could not have been any help from inside U.A., especially not a first year who had not even known all names of his classmates at that time yet. 
 
'They all fucked up', Tsukauchi thought. 'I wonder how they plan on making this right.'
 
When he wrapped up the interrogation, unchained the boy and left the room to talk to Eraserhead and everyone else, Izuku still sat on the chair.
His mind was a dark void and he couldn't think about anything except what happened. 
 
They thought he was a traitor...
After everything he did for them... 
They thought he was a villain...
 
There were noises outside the interrogation room, but Izuku couldn't care less. Slowly, as if on autopilot, he stood up, grabbed his notebook and opened the door.
The voices were even louder, he clearly heard them talking, but strangely couldn't make out a single word. Until...
 
"IZUKU!"
 
The voices abruptly stopped and it was as if  reality crashed down on him, because he suddenly became aware of how his eyes were still leaking tears, how his heart was aching and how he was trembling all over.
His vision was blurry, but he could make out two boys coming towards him...
"Hi-Hitoshi... Shouto..." he whispered, before his knees buckled, and just before he crashed onto the floor, two strong arms wrapped around his body and pulled him into a broad chest.
He inhaled deeply and smelled lavender.
'Hitoshi...'
 
Both boys sank to the floor, and another hand came to rest on his back, making circle motions to calm him down.
 
At the state of the boy, Shinsou and Todoroki were outraged. How could their teachers have done something like that?!
 
Weren't they supposed to be trusted?
 
How could they have hurt their friend in such a cruel and heartless way?
 
Izuku continued sobbing into the purple haired boy's shoulder for a while, before he simply...stopped.
 
He didn't have any tears left to cry.
 
'How could they have done that... After all I did for them...', 
 
After a while Midoriya tried standing up on wobbly feet, Todoroki and Shinsou steadying him.
 
He heard another voice speak up.
"M-Midori-"
 
"Don't touch him!" Hitoshi screamed.
 
"Don't any of you dare come any closer to him!"
 
Aizawa, and Sir Nighteye halted in their tracks at the look of pure hate the two boys were giving them. 
Aizawa still tried taking a step forward. "Listen-"
 
In less than a second, the floor was covered in ice and all the police officers and teachers were stuck in it.
"If any of you ever dare come any closer to him, you'll see who real villains are."
 
Todoroki leveled them with a glare colder than his ice, hostile and unforgiving, before the kids turned on their heels and started walking away towards the entrance of the police station, leaving everyone else behind.
 
 
 
 
Outside, the trio walked towards a white car. 
The front door of it opened and Present Mic came out.
"Hey, hey, how is he feeling?" the blonde haired man asked Shinsou and Todoroki once he saw the unresponsive state Midoriya was in. Those blank eyes and stiff posture... It scared him to no end to see one of his brightest students like that. 
 
Shinsou and Todoroki merely shook their heads, but otherwise remained silent. 
 
With a pained sigh, Yamada led the trio towards the car, Todoroki sitting in the passenger seat, while Hitoshi and Izuku remained in the back seats. 
Starting the car, they drove off back towards U.A. and to the dorms. 
 
"H-Hitoshi...?" Midoriya stuttered out somewhere during the ride. Instantly, the mind quirk user's attention was on him and he squeezed the boy's hand. 
"Izuku, how are you feeling?" 
 
The greenette's gaze drifted away as his mind kept replaying what happened. 
"They... They think... I'm not..." 
 
Putting his arms around him, Shinsou squeezed Izuku comfortingly whilst carding a hand through the forest green locks. 
"It's okay Izuku... I know... It's going to be okay..." 
 
'Hopefully...', he silently added in his head. 
 
Occasional hiccups were the only thing that could be heard in the car as they came closer to the school, and by the time the car stopped right in front of it, it was completely silent. 
 
Carefully so as not to scare the green haired boy, Hitoshi took his hand and climbed out of the car, not letting go even when they came to stand in front of Heights Alliance. Todoroki was standing on the other side of Midoriya, and Present Mic already said goodbye to the three of them, promising to visit later. 
 
"Are you ready?" Shouto quietly asked, squeezing his friend's hand reassuringly when the other hesitated. 
"We'll go straight to your room, okay?" Hitoshi promised and pushed open the door. 
 
Their steps were silent, but not intentionally so. Either way, nobody noticed them at first. 
 
Tsuyu was the first one. 
"Midoriya-chan, Shinsou-chan, Todoroki-chan, how are you?" 
 
Shouto and Hitoshi shrugged and glanced at Midoriya, who hasn't budged even after being addressed. But after Todoroki motioned with his head upstairs, she stood up and made her way over to the males, and together they continued their way upstairs towards Izuku's room. 
 
"Hey guys! What's up?" Ashido asked as she came around the corner, Kirishima, Sero and Kaminari with her. 
 
Todoroki almost punched his classmates at the question. 

How dare they ask something like that after what they did? 

They group was casting nervous glances at Midoriya, clearly not aware that he was innocent. 
The half white half red haired teen was just about to retort something, when Shinsou unexpectedly spoke up. 
 
"Good. And you?" 
 
"Oh, we're" - before Mina could continue, her eyes glazed over and her face went completely slack. 
"Leave", Hitoshi commanded, her friends watching helplessly as she turned on her heels and walked into the direction from which she came from. 
"Hey man, no need to be so-" 
 
"What rude? Why shouldn't I, after what you did?" Shinsou's eyes narrowed, glinting dangerously at Kaminari and his other two friends. 
"Listen, what should-" Kirishima was the next one to fall under the purple haired teen's control, and just like Mina, Shinsou commanded the red haired teen to leave.
